subject: Self Care
title: Non-Attachment Explained
description: A quick, practical guide to Non-Attachment Explained.

hook.text: A monk's favorite teacup breaks. He smiles. 'It was already broken,' he says. What did he mean?

buildup.text: Non-attachment means enjoying things fully without requiring them to last. It's freedom, not indifference.

discovery.text: Buddhist philosophy teaches that suffering comes from clinging ‚Äî to outcomes, possessions, and identities.

twist.text: Non-attachment doesn't mean not caring. You can love deeply and still accept that everything changes.

climax.text: Practicing non-attachment reduces anxiety about the future and grief about the past simultaneously.

punchline.text: Hold everything gently. Clinging creates suffering.

quiz.question: What does non-attachment mean?
options: Enjoying experiences without requiring them to last forever
